metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23597 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description: A compromised web child process could disable web security opening restrictions, leading to a new child process being spawned within the file:// context. Given a reliable exploit primitive, this new process could be exploited again leading to arbitrary file read. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 109.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
